Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Dollar General agreed to pay $1.75 million to resolve claims that it sold products that were advertised on the shelf at a lower price than the price at the register, even after being told at least 50 times by state inspectors from the Agency of Agriculture, Food and Markets to correct the pricing inaccuracies.
Info Source: https://ago.vermont.gov/blog/2019/06/06/vermont-to-receive-1-75-million-from-dollar-general-for-pricing-inaccuracies/

Description: Dolgen California, operators of Dollar General stores in California, agreed to pay $1.125 million in settlement of allegations it violated state hazardous waste law concerning handling, transporting and disposing of hazardous products sold and used by its stores around California. The settlement was with 32 California District Attorneys.
Info Source: http://rivcoda.org/opencms/system/galleries/download/daReleases/NEWS_RELEASE_--_Dollar_General_stores_ordered_to_pay_more_than_$1_million_in_civil_settlement_of_environmental_prosecution.pdf
